etymologies: late Middle English: shortening of Old French espurge, from espurgier, from Latin expurgare ‘cleanse’ (because of the purgative properties of the milky latex)

definitions: a herbaceous plant or shrub with milky latex and very small, typically greenish, flowers. Many kinds are cultivated as ornamentals and some are of commercial importance.

notes.text: Genus Euphorbia, family Euphorbiaceae: numerous species

shortDefinitions: herbaceous plant or shrub with milky latex and very small flowers
